text: James John Day (8 February 1850 – 19 February 1895) was an English first-class cricketer. Day was born at Holborn in February 1850. Day made his debut in first-class cricket for the Gentlemen of the South against the Gentlemen of the North at Beeston in 1870. The following year he made two appearances for W. G. Grace's personal XI in two fixtures against Kent in 1871, at Maidstone and Gravesend. Day batted on three innings during his brief first-class career, scoring a single run and being dismissed without scoring on two occasions. Day died at Battersea in February 1895. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1850 births Category:1895 deaths Category:People from Holborn Category:English cricketers Category:Gentlemen of the South cricketers Category:W. G. Grace's XI cricketers
title: James Day (cricketer)
